clusters.title: ‘I feel like there was foul play’: Qld man’s body returned from Bali with heart missing
clusters.neutral_headline: Queensland Man's Body Returned from Bali Missing Heart
bullet_summary: A second autopsy performed in Queensland revealed the body was missing the organ
The FIFO worker was hoping to relax on a fun getaway, but his body was found in the plunge pool of his villa in May

items.title: ‘I feel like there was foul play’: Qld man’s body returned from Bali with heart missing
items.standfirst: A second autopsy performed in Queensland revealed the body was missing the organ.
items.content: A second autopsy performed in Queensland revealed the body was missing the organ.

items.title: Queensland man's body returned from Bali with vital organ missing
items.standfirst: The FIFO worker was hoping to relax on a fun getaway, but his body was found in the plunge pool of his villa in May.
items.content: A grieving family is demanding answers after their son's body was returned from Bali after his mysterious death with a vital organ missing.Byron Haddow, 23, never made it home from his Bali holiday.The FIFO worker was hoping to relax on a fun getaway, but his body was found in the plunge pool of his villa in May.READ MORE: Optus crisis deepens as telco reveals it missed warnings His death was only the beginning of a long and traumatic quest for answers from his devastated family.Bryon's family pushed for an investigation resulted in a major delay in repatriating his remains back to Noosa. His mum Chantal told 9News she suspects something sinister happened."I feel like there was foul play," she said. When his body finally was brought home, a horrifying discovery made in a second autopsy by the Queensland coroner.READ MORE: Albanese touches down in New York ahead of first meeting with Trump His heart was missing."They just rung us to ask if we were aware that his heart was retained over in Bali," Chantal said. "It was another kick in the guts." It remains unclear why Byron's organ was removed. It was only sent back to Australia months after his funeral and burial. READ MORE: Remains found in search for missing woman, 71, after house fireThe results of a local autospy report are still pending.Meanwhile, Chantal is still coming to terms with her devastating loss."He was just so full of life," she added.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

ai_summary: A Queensland man's body was returned from Bali.
The man's heart was missing from his body.
A second autopsy confirmed the missing organ.
The man was a FIFO worker.
The man's body was found in a villa's pool.

clusters.title: Optus outage 'unlikely' to have contributed to eight-week-old baby's death
clusters.neutral_headline: Optus Outage Impacted Emergency Services

items.title: Optus outage 'unlikely' to have contributed to eight-week-old baby's death
items.standfirst: A critical outage in the telco giant's network meant Triple Zero calls in South Australia, Western Australia and the Northern Territory were blocked
items.content: An initial investigation has revealed the death of an eight-week-old baby on Thursday was unlikely to have been contributed to by a triple zero outage on the Optus network.A critical outage in the telco giant's network meant triple zero calls in South Australia, Western Australia and the Northern Territory were blocked, with the company announcing it had contributed to three deaths; a fourth was later confirmed by WA Premier Roger Cook.One of the initial deaths announced by Optus was that of an eight-month-old baby boy in Gawler, north of Adelaide.Opinion: Optus has many questions to answer after another staggering failureThe boy's grandmother had initially told police she had tried to call triple zero on her mobile phone after realising her grandson was not breathing.However, a statement from South Australia Police today has shed more light on the incident, revealing it was likely not a factor behind the infant's tragic death."While the family was impacted by the Optus outage, it appears at this stage it is unlikely to have contributed to the death," the statement said."When her call was not connected, she immediately used another mobile telephone in the house and was successfully connected to triple zero.READ MORE: 'I'm absolutely disgusted': South Australian man couldn't call for ambulance during Optus outage"The preliminary investigations indicate the child's death is not due to any delay in SAAS [emergency services] attending the Mulga St house, despite the failure of the first attempt to call 000."SA Police said it did not usually make public comments such as this, but believed the public interest in the story meant transparency was required.They confirmed a full investigation was being provided to the coroner, who will decide whether an inquest will be required.Police also said the investigation into other death in the state connected to the outage, a 68-year-old woman from Queenstown, was still ongoing.Optus chief executive Stephen Rue is scheduled to address the media at 3pm AEST today.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

items.title: Optus triple-0 outage wider than first reported, CEO admits

items.content: Optus reveals that in addition to customers in South Australia, Western Australia and the Northern Territory, two people in New South Wales were unable to connect to emergency services during the 13-hour outage last Thursday.

ai_summary: Optus outage impacted emergency services.
The outage affected triple-0 calls.
The outage lasted for thirteen hours.
Two people in New South Wales were affected.
The outage was wider than initially reported.

clusters.title: UK fighter jets begin NATO air defence mission over Poland
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Fighter Jets Begin NATO Air Defence Mission Over Poland

items.title: UK fighter jets begin NATO air defence mission over Poland
items.standfirst: British fighter jets fly their first NATO air defence unit over Poland as part of a mission to bolster the Western alliance's defences following a Russian drone incursion this month.
